result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L Parks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Michael L Parks was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael L Parks is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Michael L Parks was found guilty of 1st Deg. Sexual Assault/Aided by Others, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(c).
  • Michael L Parks was found guilty of 1st Deg. Sexual Assault-Use/Dang.Weapon [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(b).
  • Michael L Parks was found guilty of 1st Deg. Sexual Assault/Aided by Others [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

supervisions.notes:
550 days credit.
Pursuant to Stipulation and Order Amending Judgment of Conviction, Court orders 561 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Count 3 & 4 and Eau Claire Co. Case 14CF884.

superMiscConds.notes:
re: Count 2 - $250 represents DNA surcharge.  
re: Count 3 - $250 represents DNA surcharge.  
re: Count 4 - $250 represents DNA surcharge.
Plus supervision fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

No contact with: S.K., their residence or place of employment, their family or their residences.   
Not to possess or consume any controlled substance not prescribed by authorized medical personnel.  
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.  
Not to possess any firearms or body armour.

Comply with Sex Offender Registry
Provide DNA Sample

561 days credit. (see Count 2)
Concurrent with: Count 2 & 4 and Eau Claire Co. Case 14CF884.

01:35 PM Defendant Michael L Parks in court with Attorney Catherine Malchow.  Defendant Michael L Parks in custody.  Roy La Barton Gay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Gay states case and notes appearances.
Defense witness Atty J. Weber sworn & questioned by Attorney Malchow. 
Exhibit 1 & 2 received. 
Witness cross-examined by ADA Gay. Re-direct. Witness questioned by the court. Re-direct.Re-cross. 
Exhibit 3 received. 
Attorney Malchow presents argument re: prior untruthful allegations of sexual assault. ADA Gay responds. Attorney Malchow rebuttal. Court finds the facts in the prior act is not similar to facts of this case - motion denied. 
ADA Gay addresses five necessary elements. Attorney Malchow responds. Court outlines elements as they relate to this case. 
Attorney Malchow presents argument re: deceitful conduct. ADA Gay responds. Attorney Malchow rebuttal. Court finds prior ruling to be appropriate - motion denied. 
Court addresses Section C of Motion re: opportunity to present evidence and effectively cross-examine witness. ADA responds. Court finds that the introduction of evidence would have been unfairly prejudicial - motion denied. 
Court addresses Section D of Motion. Counsel responds. Court denies motion.
Court addresses motion re: plain error and request for new trial.  Attorney Malchow responds. ADA Gay responds.  Attorney Malchow rebuttal. Court finds no basis of deficient performance or ineffective counsel - motion denied.
Court addresses Multiplicitous acts. Attorney Malchow responds. ADA Gay responds. Court finds the charges are not identical - motion denied.
Attorney Malchow argues that the cumulative effect warrants a new trial. ADA Gay responds. Attorney Malchow rebuttal. Court does not find a basis for new trial - motion denied. 
Court addresses records of psychiatrist. Attorney Malchow responds. Court has reviewed records - motion denied. Court further orders psychiatrist records be sealed and only accessable to the court.  
Attorney Malchow to prepare Order.

Day 2-  Defendant Michael L Parks in court, in custody, with attorney Jessie Gwynn Weber.  Wade C. Newell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  8:21am- Judge Cray states case and notes appearances.  Attorneys and Judge discuss matters re: witness 
  8:26am- Court adjourns.
  8:33am- Court resumes, same appearances.
  8:34am- Jury enters courtrooom.
  8:36am- Defendant's Witness, C. Fisher-LE Phillips Outpatient Mental Health Therapist of S.K. sworn in and testifies. Atty. Weber introduces Exhibit 1 page 61 to Witness, C. Fisher.
  8:40am- ADA Newell cross-examines C. Fisher, offers Exhibit 2 to witness
  8:43am- Atty. Weber asks for brief Sidebar with ADA Newell and Judge.
  8:44am- ADA Newell continues to cross-examine and offers Exhibit 3 to witness
  8:46am- Juror has question of Witness, C. Fisher, Bailiff JC delivers to ADA Newell, Atty. Weber, then to Judge.  Judge asks question to witness.
  8:46am- ADA Newell re-crosses C. Fisher
  8:47am- Juror has question of Witness, C. Fisher, Bailiff JC delivers to ADA Newell, Atty. Weber and Judge.  Judge asks question to witness.
  8:49am- Defendant's Witness,C. Fisher is excused and steps down from stand.
  8:50am- Defendant's Witness, A.G.P. sworn in and testifies.  
  8:52am- ADA Newell cross-examines A.G.P.
  8:54am- Atty. Weber re-directs A.G.P.
  8:55am- Juror has question, Bailiff JC delivers to ADA Newell, Atty. Weber, then Judge.
  8:57am- Judge asks AGP question and A.G.P. responds.
  8:58am- Juror has question, Bailiff JC delivers to ADA Newell, Atty. Weber and Judge.  Judge asks A.G.P. question and A.G.P. responds.  ADA Newell re-crosses A.G.P.
  8:59am- Defendant's Witness, A.G.P. is excused and steps down from stand.
  9:00am- Defendant's Witness, M.S. sworn in and testifies.
  9:02am- ADA Newell cross-examines M.S.
  9:04am- Atty, Weber re-directs M.S.
  9:06am- Juror has question of witness, Bailiff JC delivers to ADA Newell, Atty. Weber, then to Judge.
  9:07am- Atty. Weber asks for Sidebar on question#2 listed by Juror.
  9:08am- M.S. is asked question 1 and responds.  M.S. is asked question 2 and responds.  M.S. is excused and steps down.
  9:09am- Defendant's Witness, E.A.L. sworn in and testifies.
  9:17am- ADA Newell Cross-examines E.A.L.
  9:20am- Atty. Weber re-directs E.A.L.
  9:20am- ADA Newell re-crosses E.A.L.
  9:20am- Atty. Weber re-directs E.A.L.
  9:21am- Juror has question, Bailiff JC delivers to ADA Newell, Atty. Weber, then Judge.  ADA Newell asks for Sidebar with Atty. Weber and Judge
  9:22am- Judge asks E.A.L. question and E.A.L. responds.  ADA Newell re-crosses E.A.L.
  9:23am- Judge asks EAL 2nd question from same Juror and E.A.L. pauses and responds.
  9:24am- Juror has another question, Bailiff JC delivers question to ADA Newell, Atty. Weber and then Judge.  Judge then asks E.A.L. question and E.A.L. responds.  E.A.L. is dismissed from court and steps down.
  9:25am- Jury exits courtroom, Judge makes Mr. Parks aware of his rights of testifying.
  9:26am- Court breaks for 10 min. and Judge makes court aware of break at 10:30 for bonds.
  9:42am- Court resumes , appearances remains the same.
  9:43am- Jury re-enters courtroom.
  9:44am- Defendant, Michael L. Parks sworn in and testifies.
  9:53am- ADA Newell cross-examines Defendant.
10:08am- Atty. Weber re-directs.  
10:09am- ADA Newell re-crosses.
10:10am- ADA Newell asks to be heard outside the Jury.  Jury exits Courtroom.
10:11am- ADA Newell and Atty. Weber discuss legal issues with Judge.
10:18am- Jury re-enters Courtroom
10:18am- ADA Newell continues to re-cross Defendant.
10:19am- Atty. Weber re-directs Defendant.
10:20am- Jurors have 4 questions of Defendant, Bailiff JC delivers to ADA Newell, Atty. Weber and Judge.
10:21am- Judge asks Defendant question 1 & 2 from same Juror.  Judge asks both and Mr. Parks responds.
10:23am- Bailiff JC delivers question to ADA Newell, Atty. Weber and Judge.
10:24am- Atty. Weber asks for a Sidebar with ADA Newell and Judge.
10:26am- Judge asks Defendant next juror question, Mr. Parks responds.  Judge asks another question from same Juror and Mr. Parks answers.  Judge asks last question of same Juror and Mr. Parks responds.  Last question from same Juror Judge is not asking.
10:29am- Bailiff JC delivers another Juror question to ADA Newell, Atty. Weber, then to Judge.  Judge asks another question of same question. Mr. Parks responds.
10:31am- Bailiff JC delivers another Juror question to ADA Newell, Atty. Weber, then to Judge.  Judge asks Mr. Parks question, Mr. Parks responds. Attys. ask to be heard outside of Jury re: next juror question.
10:32am- Jury exits courtroom for Attys. and Judge discuss legal questions and court adjourns for Bond Hearings.
10:52am- Court back in session without Jury. 
10:56am- Jury re-enters courtroom.  Judge Cray asks Mr. Parks juror question and Mr. Parks responds.  
10:57am- ADA re-crosses Defendant.  Defendant, Michael Parks is excused and steps down from stand.
10:58am- Plaintiff's Defendant, D. Brettingen takes the stand and is cross-examined by Atty. Weber.  D. Brettingen steps down from stand.
10:59am- Jury exits courtroom.
11:00am- Court recesses for 5 min.
11:07am-Court back in session without Jury
11:08am- Jury re-enters courtroom
11:09am- Rebuttle witness, S.K. takes stand and testifies.
11:14am- Atty. Weber cross-examines S.K.
11:15am- ADA Newell re-directs S.K.
11:16am- Jurors have 2 questions of S.K.  Bailiff JC delivers Juror question 1 to ADA Newell, Atty. Weber and Judge.
11:17am- Judge asks S.K. juror question, S.K. responds.
11:18am- Bailiff delivers 2nd question to ADA Newell, Atty. Weber, then Judge.
11:18am- Judge asks S.K. juror question and S.K. responds.
11:19am- ADA Newell re-directs S.K.
11:20am- Atty. Weber re-crosses S.K.   S.K. steps down from stand.
11:22am- Rebuttle Witness, D. Brettingen takes the stand. Atty. Weber
11:23am- Court receives pg. 61 only of Exhibit 1 and receives Exhibit 2 and 3.
11:24am- Jury is excused from courtroom for lunch. 
11:25am- Court addresses Jury instructions with Attys. 
11:28am- Court adjourns for 20 minutes.
11:56am-12:25 p.m.- Court back in session without presence of Jury to discuss Jury Instructions/wording with Attorneys and Judge.

Defendant Michael L Parks in court, in custody, with attorney Jessie Gwynn Weber.  Wade C. Newell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
12:59pm- Court resumes, appearances remain the same.  
  1:01pm- Jury returns to courtroom, trial continues.
  1:03pm- S.K. sworn in and testifies, victim identifies Defendant.
  1:08pm- Atty. Weber and ADA Newell approach your Honor.  Jury is excused from courtroom briefly, Judge to discuss legal issues with Attorneys.
  1:10pm- Atty. Weber requests for court to not refer to Mr. Parks as nickname "Big Mike" as could be prejudicial to the Defendant. Court rules no case law to support restriction.
  1:14pm- Jury re-enters Courtroom, appearances remain the same.  Trial resumes, S.K. continues testimony.
  1:36pm- Atty. Weber cross-examines S.K.  
  1:51pm- Attys. approach bench for brief discussion with Judge.
  1:52pm- Court resumes.  Atty. Weber offers Exhibit 1 to S.K. on stand, refers to page 61-excerpt from Counselor.
  1:59pm- ADA Newell requests a sidebar and approaches Judge along with Atty. Weber.
  2:00pm- Jury is excused from Courtroom briefly.  Judge discusses legal issues with Attorneys re: Controlled Buy and record of S.K.'s counselor.
  2:13pm- Jury re-enters courtroom.  Atty. Weber continues to cross-examine S.K.
  2:14pm- ADA Newell asks to have jury excused again for discussion.  Jury is excused from Courtroom. Attys. discuss admission of prior Pre-Trial info.

  2:22pm- ADA Newell re-directs S.K.

  2:30pm- Atty. Weber re-crosses S.K. after Juror question.  
  2:32pm- S.K. excused from witness stand.
  2:33pm- Jury excused & exits courtroom as Jury and court break for 10 minutes.
  2:44pm- Court resumes, Jury re-enters Courtroom.
  2:45pm- Plaintiff's Witness, T.K. sworn in and testifies.  
  2:50pm- Atty. Weber cross-examines T.K.
  2:53pm- ADA Newell re-directs T.K.
  2:55pm- Atty. Weber re-crosses T.K.
  2:56pm- ADA Newell re-directs.

  3:08pm- Atty. Weber cross-examines D.Brettingen.

  3:25pm- Atty. Weber re-crosses D. Brettingen.
  3:27pm- ADA Newell re-directs D. Brettingen.
  3:28pm- Court asks Jurors if any questions of the witness.  They turn in 3 to Bailiff JC.  Bailiff JC hands 1st juror question to Atty. Weber then to Judge. Judge asks Witness D. Brettigen 1st question. Bailiff JC delivers 2nd then 3rd questions to  Atty. Weber, each contains 2 questions so Judge views questions and then offers to ADA Newell and questions given back to Judge by Bailiff JC.
  3:30pm- Jury excused from courtroom for Attorneys to discuss Juror questions' with Judge.  Clerk requested to make copies of 2 Juror questions' including 2 questions on each page and gives to Atty. Weber and ADA Newell. 
  3:43pm- Jury re-enters courtroom,  Judge addresses Jurors' questions with the Jury. 
  3:46pm- Judge asks D. Brettingen two allowable Juror questions.  
  3:48pm- Atty. Weber re-directs D. Brettingen after juror question.
  3:49pm- Juror has another question, Bailiff JC delivers to ADA Newell, Atty. Weber and then to Judge.
  3:50pm- ADA Newell asks Judge for Sidebar with Atty. Weber.
  3:50pm- Judge asks D. Brettigen Juror question and then Ms. Brettigen is asked to step down from stand.
  3:52pm- Defendant's witness, Investigator S. McMahon of CFPD/West Central Drug Task Force sworn in and testifies.

  3:55pm- Atty. Weber re-directs Investigator S. McMahon.

  4:06pm- Atty. Weber re-directs R.T.

  4:30 pm- Court adjourns, Attorneys to be present at 8:15 tomorrow, 11/12/2015 to discuss any issues and Jury to report at 8:30 a.m. for Day 2 of Jury Trial.

9:55 a.m. Defendant Michael L Parks in court with attorney Jessie Gwynn Weber.  Defendant Michael L Parks in custody.  Wade C. Newell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Without jurors present.  Court back on record after short break to allow Attorney Weber to review a series of paperwork/reports she received from ADA Newell.  Court addressed Attorney Weber.  Attorney Weber responded to the Court - information in the paperwork she received from ADA Newell needs follow up and Attorney Weber believes it may change the defense trial strategy.  Attorney Weber requests an adjournment of the jury trial to follow up on the information in the paperwork she received a short time ago and was informed by ADA Newell that he would not object to an adjournment.  Court grants motion for adjournment.  Court addressed/questioned the defendant, Michael Parks, and the defendant agrees with an adjournment. Jury trial rescheduled to September 23 & 24, 2015.  The attorneys to meet with the Court at 8:30 a.m.  Jury trial to begin at 9 a.m.  Final pretrial motions to be submitted to the Court by August 21, 2015.  Bond continued.  Court adjourned at 10:04 a.m.
